meanings.definition: The amount of space within a three-dimensional object, measured in cubic units.
meanings.sent1: The cubage of the box was small, so it couldn't hold many toys.
meanings.sent2: The architect calculated the cubage of the room to determine the amount of paint needed.
meanings.sent3: The cubage of the tiny jar was so limited that it could only store a few marbles.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm had a cubage that filled the room with positive energy.
meanings.sent5: The cubage of the balloon determined how much helium it could hold.

meanings.definition: The act or process of calculating the volume or capacity of something.
meanings.sent1: After the cubage of the pool was determined, they knew how much water it could hold.
meanings.sent2: The cubage of the storage unit was crucial for planning the move.
meanings.sent3: The cubage of the cake tin was mistakenly calculated, resulting in an overflowing batter.
meanings.sent4: Her cubage of emotions overflowed as she tried to contain her excitement.
meanings.sent5: The cubage of the suitcase limited the number of clothes she could pack.

meanings.definition: The total volume or capacity of a container or enclosed space.
meanings.sent1: The cubage of the shipping container determined how much cargo it could carry.
meanings.sent2: The cubage of the refrigerator was enough to store a week's worth of groceries.
meanings.sent3: The cubage of the jar surprised her when it held more than expected.
meanings.sent4: His cubage of knowledge was vast, filling every bookshelf in the room.
meanings.sent5: The cubage of the water tank was insufficient for the dry season.
